text:
e="preserve">Igor Matovič (born 11 May 1973) is a Slovak politician. Matovič is the Prime Minister of Slovakia since 2020. He is a member of the Ordinary People. In 2010, he was elected as a member of the National Council. Matovič was born in Trnava, Czechoslovakia.
Matovič's party won the majority of votes in the 2020 Slovak parliamentary election on 29 February 2020, winning 53 seats in the 150-member National Council with 25.02% of the vote. On 13 March, Matovič announced he had reached an agreement for a governing coalition for a new cabinet to form. Matovič was sworn in Prime Minister on 21 March.
